update.description: Update: Changed ruby initialization. `ruby_init` is now called once on startup, which seems to be very important.
update.title: Adding ERB parsing to SDF

content.raw:
~~~
diff -r e29ac54726e8 cmake/sdf_config.cmake.in
--- a/cmake/sdf_config.cmake.in	Fri Oct 10 11:11:12 2014 -0700
+++ b/cmake/sdf_config.cmake.in	Fri Oct 10 15:42:08 2014 -0700
@@ -3,6 +3,8 @@
 endif()
 set(@PKG_NAME@_CONFIG_INCLUDED TRUE)
 
+include (FindPkgConfig)
+
 list(APPEND @PKG_NAME@_INCLUDE_DIRS @CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX@/include/sdformat-@SDF_VERSION@)
 
 list(APPEND @PKG_NAME@_CFLAGS -I@CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX@/include/sdformat-@SDF_VERSION@)
@@ -39,8 +41,11 @@
 
 foreach (ver ${ruby_versions})
   # Check if pkg-config finds ruby
-  pkg_check_modules(ruby ruby-${ver})
-  if (NOT ruby_FOUND)
+  if (PKG_CONFIG_FOUND)
+    pkg_check_modules(ruby ruby-${ver})
+  endif()
+
+  if (NOT ruby_FOUND OR NOT PKG_CONFIG_FOUND)
     if (${ver} EQUAL 1.9)
       set (ver_full 1.9.1)
     elseif(${ver} EQUAL 1.8)
~~~
content.html:
diff -r e29ac54726e8 cmake/sdf_config.cmake.in
--- a/cmake/sdf_config.cmake.in Fri Oct 10 11:11:12 2014 -0700
+++ b/cmake/sdf_config.cmake.in Fri Oct 10 15:42:08 2014 -0700
@@ -3,6 +3,8 @@
 endif()
 set(@PKG_NAME@_CONFIG_INCLUDED TRUE)

+include (FindPkgConfig)
+
 list(APPEND @PKG_NAME@_INCLUDE_DIRS @CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX@/include/sdformat-@SDF_VERSION@)

 list(APPEND @PKG_NAME@_CFLAGS -I@CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX@/include/sdformat-@SDF_VERSION@)
@@ -39,8 +41,11 @@

 foreach (ver ${ruby_versions})
   # Check if pkg-config finds ruby
-  pkg_check_modules(ruby ruby-${ver})
-  if (NOT ruby_FOUND)
+  if (PKG_CONFIG_FOUND)
+    pkg_check_modules(ruby ruby-${ver})
+  endif()
+
+  if (NOT ruby_FOUND OR NOT PKG_CONFIG_FOUND)
     if (${ver} EQUAL 1.9)
       set (ver_full 1.9.1)
     elseif(${ver} EQUAL 1.8)

content.raw:
This doesn't work either:
~~~
In file included from /home/ubuntu/src/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/include/sdf/ruby.hh:26:0,
                 from /home/ubuntu/src/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/parser.cc:23:
/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/ruby/ruby.h:24:25: fatal error: ruby/config.h: No such file or directory
compilation terminated.
~~~
Note that this deb installs the following files:
~~~
/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/ruby/ruby.h
…
/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/x86_64-linux/ruby/config.h
~~~
I think `find_path(RUBY_INCLUDE_DIRS NAMES ruby.h PATHS /usr/include/ruby-${ver_full})` won't capture that arch-dependent include folder.
content.html:
This doesn't work either:

In file included from /home/ubuntu/src/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/include/sdf/ruby.hh:26:0,
                 from /home/ubuntu/src/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/parser.cc:23:
/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/ruby/ruby.h:24:25: fatal error: ruby/config.h: No such file or directory
compilation terminated.

Note that this deb installs the following files:

/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/ruby/ruby.h
…
/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/x86_64-linux/ruby/config.h

I think find_path(RUBY_INCLUDE_DIRS NAMES ruby.h PATHS /usr/include/ruby-${ver_full}) won't capture that arch-dependent include folder.

content.raw:
I've been testing this on my mac laptop (osx 10.8.5), using the default ruby version 1.8.7, and I made a fix in bb05a43 (branch parse_erb_2.0_scpeters) that was causing the build to fail on my laptop. Also, I added a `NOT RUBY_FOUND` to some checking logic, since find_package would still set `RUBY_LIBRARY` even when an invalid version was found. I also added some cmake messages to indicate how it was trying to find ruby.

I need to do a little more testing with drone.io since that build is failing
content.html:
I've been testing this on my mac laptop (osx 10.8.5), using the default ruby version 1.8.7, and I made a fix in bb05a43 (branch parse_erb_2.0_scpeters) that was causing the build to fail on my laptop. Also, I added a NOT RUBY_FOUND to some checking logic, since find_package would still set RUBY_LIBRARY even when an invalid version was found. I also added some cmake messages to indicate how it was trying to find ruby.

I need to do a little more testing with drone.io since that build is failing
